contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=July 2009}} {{Infobox surname | name = Xue | image = 薛姓 - 楷体.svg | image_size = | caption = Xue surname in [[regular script]] | pronunciation = Xuē <small>(Pinyin)</small><br/>Sih <small>([[Pe̍h-ōe-jī]])</small> | language = Chinese | languageorigin = [[Old Chinese]] | origin = | derivation = | meaning = | variant = Xue, Hsueh <small>(Mandarin)</small><br/>Sit <small>(Cantonese)</small><br/>Sih <small>([[Hokkien]], [[Teochew dialect|Teochew]])</small><br/>Seol <small>(Korean)</small><br/>Tiết <small>(Vietnamese)</small><!--- <small>(Taishanese)</small><br/> <small>(Gan)</small><br/>--> | cognate = | derivative = | seealso = | family = }} {{See also|Xue Rengui|Selenga River}} '''Xue''' is the [[pinyin]] romanization of the [[Chinese surname]] 薛 (Xuē), '''Hsueh''' in the [[Wade-Giles]] system. In [[Hong Kong]] and [[Macau]] it is usually romanized through its [[Cantonese]] pronunciation '''Sit'''. In [[Korean language|Korean]], it corresponds to '''[[Seol (Korean name)|Seol]]''' (설), in [[Japanese language|Japanese]] to '''Setsu''' and in [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]] to '''Tiết'''. According to the [[Sixth National Population Census of the People's Republic of China|2010 Chinese Census]], it is the [[List of common Chinese surnames|76th most common surname in China]], a sharp decline from 48th in 1982. In a study by [[geneticist]] [[Yuan Yida]] on the [[Chinese_surname#Distribution_of_surnames|distribution of Chinese surnames]], people who carry the name Xue are dispersed throughout the country and is most heavily concentrated in [[Shaanxi]]. ==Origin== The surname traces back to the [[March (territory)|march of Xue]] in what is modern day [[Shandong]]. [[Yu the Great]], founding emperor of the [[Xia dynasty]], bestowed upon his minister [[Xi Zhong]] the title [[Chinese nobility|Marquis of Xue]] in gratitude for his invention of the [[chariot (China)|Chinese chariot]]; Xi Zhong's descendants subsequently bore Xue as their clan name. [[Sinicization|Sinicized]] descendants of various [[Ethnic minorities in China|non-Han Chinese]] peoples also adopted Xue as their surname, including the [[Göktürk]] [[Xueyantuo|Syr-Tardush]] tribe, the [[Xianbei]] [[Change of Xianbei names to Han names|Chigan]] clan and several [[Manchu people|Manchu]] clans such as [[List of Manchu clans|Sakda Hala, Sue Hala, Sunit Hala]] etc. ==In literature== In the [[Four Great Classical Novels|classical novel]] [[Dream of the Red Chamber]] by [[Cao Xueqin]], the Xue family is one of the four noble families of [[Jinling]]. The socially graceful debutante [[Xue Baochai]], a literary embodiment of ideal traditional Chinese femininity, is one of the principal characters in the novel. ==Notable people with the surname Xue (薛)== *[[Xue Baochai]], one of the principal characters in the classic Chinese novel ''[[Dream of the Red Chamber]]'' *[[Xue Changrui]], a Chinese pole vaulter, Asian Champion 2013 *[[Xue Chen]], Chinese professional beach volleyball player *[[Xue Feng]], American geologist held in China on espionage charges *[[Xue Haifeng]], archer who competed in the 2004 and 2008 Summer Olympics *[[Xue Hanqin]], judge at [[International Court of Justice]] *[[Xue Ji]], Tang dynasty calligrapher *[[Nancy Sit|Xue Jiayan (Nancy Sit)]], Hong Kong actress *[[Xue Jinghua]], the ''prima ballerina'' of the ballet [[Red Detachment of Women (ballet)|Red Detachment of Women]] *[[Xue Ju]], founding emperor of a short-lived state of Qin at the end of the [[Sui Dynasty]] *[[Fiona Sit|Xue Kaiqi (Fiona Sit)]], Hong Kong actress/singer *[[Xue Ming]], Chinese volleyball player *[[Xue Rengao]], emperor of the short-lived state of Qin before surrendering to the founder of the [[Tang Dynasty]] [[Li Shimin]] *[[Xue Rengui]], famous early [[Tang Dynasty]] general who was is most known for his campaigns against the Korean kingdom [[Goguryeo]], the [[Tujue]] Turkish Khaganate, and the Tibetan [[Tufan]] empire *[[Xue Tao]], a female poet of Tang dynasty *[[Xue Xinran]], British-Chinese broadcaster, journalist and author *[[Xue Yue]], Chinese [[Guomindang]] Army general during the [[Second Sino-Japanese War|Sino-Japanese War]] and the [[Chinese Civil War]] *[[Jacky Xue|Xue Zhiqian (Jacky Xue)]], Chinese actor *[[Seol Chong]], [[Silla|Sillan]] scholar *[[Seol Ki-Hyeon]], South Korean footballer *[[Sol Kyung-gu]], South Korean actor {{surname|Xue}} [[Category:Chinese-language surnames]] [[ru:Сюэ]]
